title: What are the technologies that are useful for going green? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology for 'going green' encompasses several fields. Energy - this includes the development of alternative fuels, new means of generating energy and using available energy more efficiency. Farming - without using chemical fertilizers or pesticides benefits humanity two ways; protects the land and produces healthier food products. Civil Engineering - Green building encompasses everything from the design oa building and the choice of building materials to where a building is located so as to have the least impact on the environment. Chemistry - The design, development and application of chemical products and processes to reduce or to eliminate the use and generation of hazardous substances. Nanotechnology - involves the manipulation of materials at the scale of the nanometer - one billionth of a meter. Scientists believe that mastery of this field is evolving that will transform the way that everything in the world is manufactured. "Green nanotechnology" is the application of green chemistry and green engineering principles to this field. Recycling - convert waste into reusable material.
